numResult

public double numResult

boolResult

public boolean boolResult

objResult

public java.lang.Object objResult

consumeKind

public int consumeKind
Specifies what to do if this.consume(TreePosition) is called.

CONSUME_COUNT

public static final int CONSUME_COUNT
Calling consume(Node) increments consumeCount. Used to count the number of nodes in a result node-set.

CONSUME_BOOL

public static final int CONSUME_BOOL
Calling consume(Node) sets consumeKind to true and returns false. Used when converting a node-set to boolean.

CONSUME_STRING

public static final int CONSUME_STRING
Calling consume(Node) sets consumeObject to string value to true and returns false (so one first node is processed). Used to implement string(nodeset).

CONSUME_STRING_APPEND

public static final int CONSUME_STRING_APPEND
Calling consume(Node) appends string value to StringBuffer in consumeObject. Used to implement testsuite.

CONSUME_NAME

public static final int CONSUME_NAME
Calling consume(Node) save name of first node in consumeObject. Used to implement name() function.

consumeCount

public int consumeCount

public java.lang.Object consumeObject

consume

public boolean consume(TreePosition position)
Consume node. If (resultType==BOOLEAN_RESULT), we only care *if* there are any nodes.
Specified by:
consume in interface PositionConsumer
Following copied from interface: gnu.lists.PositionConsumer
Returns:
true if we are interested in more nodes.

writePosition

public boolean writePosition(AbstractSequence seq,
                             int ipos,
                             java.lang.Object xpos)
Description copied from interface: PositionConsumer
Consume a single position triple. This PositionConsumer may assume the sequence does no reference management; i.e. that copyPosition is trivial and releasePosition is a no-op. If that is not the case, use consume(TreePosition) instead.
Specified by:
writePosition in interface PositionConsumer
